Author: aston
Content: Kills me how fast WIRED postings make it in. We start discussing articles before I even get to read them in the real magazine :(

Author: paulsb
Content: I am, or at least I would be if I could find some programmers. Being out of the UK probably isn't much help to you either. As for examples, most tend to be in the drug discovery/modelling area because industry will pay for that. I think there is huge potential for targeting other areas as well as industry. Some of the really good stuff is academically based, which means it just whimpers along as the funding comes in from grants; eventually, most of these projects just die because they aren't promoted and/or developed with a business mindset.

Author: s3graham
Content: Didn't we just spend the last N+1 years desperately trying to avoid client-side downloads and installs? Seriously though, maybe in a few years, if and when the runtime comes pre-installed in most OSs/browsers (or something similar).

Author: moog
Title: Ask YC: How would you support the iPhone?
Content:
If you decide iPhone support for your new web app is important, would you:

a) Rely on the built-in Safari browser with its double taps and pinch

b) Code an iPhone optimised layout to render in Safari

c) Write a standalone iPhone app using the SDK (likely to be released on 6th of March)
